page.title: 06FARMERS OF WARE PARK, WARE
page.content: Bardon Farm,covering 150 acres of Ware Park, has 50{Friesian cows}which graze in fields by the farm. Milking at 6.00 and 15.45 takes 1\ hours and 1 hour to clear up. Most of the cows calve just before winter when milk fetches a high price. 29{heifers}graze about one mile away by the River Lea.{Rye,Timothy and {Lucerne}are grown for silage and three other fields grow{barley and wheat. Adjoining Bardon Farm is a{Carmelite {monastery}where nuns grow their own food. They drive a small tractor which sometimes needs mending by neighbours. Although a closed order, the nuns have some contact with outsiders. Last May, Rome reaffirmed the 1977 charter,which allowed outside trips and newspapers. Some of the monastery's land is used by{Ware Park Farm}for cereal crops.The farmer also keeps sheep and rears game birds for shooting in the parkland.
